CSGO is a good game, it's a free to play FPS game and you don't need a good computer to run it. When you start off in CS:GO you're a non-prime player meaning you don't gain EXP from games, you don't get loot drops, and will only play with non-prime players. This means you might run into smurfs and/or cheaters. If you just want to play CS:GO for fun I suggest sticking to non-prime. With prime you get to play with prime players meaning these people take this game a bit more seriously compared to non-prime players. Prime gives you the ability to rank up in competitive matches, gain EXP from wins, and get the chance for loot. If you are looking to take CS:GO to a next level a suggest spending your money on prime.
